div.l: And fond þe cradil with his hond anone
Be god thouȝte he al wrong haue I gon̄
My hed is toty of my swynk to nyȝt
That makith me that y go not a riȝt
I wot wel be þe cradil I haue mys go
Here lith þe myllere and his wif Also
And forth he goth a twenti devil wey
Into the bed there þe myllere lay
He wende haue cropen yn be his felow Iohn
And bi the myller͗e yn he creep anon̄
And cauȝte him be the necke ⁊and softe spak
He saide þou swyneshed awak
For cristis soule and here a nobil game
For bi that lord that callid is saint Iame
As I haue thriys in þis short nyȝt
Swyvid þe mylleris douȝter bolt vpriȝt
Whilis thou has as A coward be agaste
Ȝe false harlot hast
A fals traitour fals clerk qᵈuod he
Thou shalt be ded be goddis dignite
Who durste be so bolde to do such diꝑparage
To my douȝter þat is of such lynage
And be þe throte bolle he cauȝte Aleyn̄
And he hente him dispitosly Agayn̄
And on the nose he smot him wᵗith his fist
Doun ran the blood vp on his brest
And in þe floor with nose ⁊and mowth to broke
They walowid as piggis do in A poke
And vp þey goon̄ and doun ayen Anon̄
Til þat þe myllere sporned At a stoon̄
And doun he fil bacward on his wiff
That wiste no thing of þis nyce strif
For she was falle in slepe a litil wiȝt
With Iohn the clerk þat wakid al þe nyȝt
And with the fal out of her slepe she breid
Help holi cros of bromeham she saide
In manus tuas to þe lord I calle
